EmailTemplate.subject: 5 Measurements of successful App Transformation
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
If you’ve invested in your organization’s Application Transformation, how do you demonstrate progress and measure success?
Quantitative measurement is critical and we recommend defining-and continuously refining-KPIs for each step that covers the process, time, and cost improvements. However, there are signals that show your app transformation effort is succeeding.
-Increased software releases: Quarter over quarter improvements -Implemented release management efficiencies: Lower lead and process time, fewer steps and handoffs -Improved operational metrics for transitioned apps: MTTR, MTBD, support tickets, etc. -Enhanced security: Faster patching, zero downtime upgrades, etc. -Reduced infrastructure usage: Higher density compute, auto-scaling and licensing reductions
Read how organizations have been successful <[[https://pivotal.io/customers]]> and view the tools in our resource center <[[https://content.pivotal.io/application-modernization]]> to help you with your journey.
Enjoy! The Pivotal Team
